means: 愚蠢，蠢笨，愚蠢的行为、思想或做法( folly的名词复数 )

sentence.Network_en: She's 87 years old, and a one-time member of the Ziegfeld Follies.
sentence.Network_cn: 她现年87岁，曾经是齐格菲尔时事讽刺剧团的成员之一。

sentence.Network_en: He has given up youthful follies.
sentence.Network_cn: 他不再做年轻人的荒唐事了.

sentence.Network_en: The writings of Swift mocked the follies of his age.
sentence.Network_cn: 斯威夫特的作品嘲弄了他那个时代的愚人.

婴儿城(baby follies)福州童谣《月光光》 折纸：纸帽子的折法时间: 2011-07-15 20:58 来源: 未知作者: admin  点击: 加载中。。。
collective feeling 集体主义情感collective folly 集体愚行collective goal 集体目标

entry.def: If you say that a particular action or way of behaving is folly or a folly, you mean that it is foolish.

example.ex: It's sheer folly to build nuclear power stations in a country that has dozens of earthquakes every year.
example.tran: 在每年会发生几十次地震的国家建造核电站简直就是愚蠢至极。

example.ex: ...a reminder of the follies of war.
example.tran: 提醒人们战争之愚蠢的东西

entry.tran: (尤指旧时英国花园等中的)装饰性建筑
entry.def: A folly is a small tower or other unusual building that is built as a decoration in a large garden or park, especially in Britain in former times.

auth_sentence.content: My soule...Is hurt with mere intention on their follies.

auth_sentence.content: Nor were our follies diminished by these warnings.

auth_sentence.res_content_con: Nor were our follies diminished by these warnings.

auth_sentence.content: I won't even get into the follies created by religion.
